Brendon Murphy writes here.

See also the archive & links.

My experience runs from unix & linux system administration, to programming for the web. I'm passionate about open source, and spend much of my time these days in Ruby.

My passions include git, github, rspec, rails, jQuery, programming in general, and my girlfriend Arielle.

I like to hang out with other Ruby-ists in Orange County. You can connect with us at the monthly OC Ruby Users Group. We'd love to see you there.

WorkingWithRails is the online home of the world's community of Ruby on Rails users. Go check my profile there.

Games for this Sunday

For those of you attending game night on Sundays, I just wanted to say that our rounds of Monkey Ninja Pirate Robot for the past two weeks have been quite entertaining for me. I hope you’ve enjoyed it as well. For those that missed it, there’s probably only two things to know. First, Daryl and I are in competition with each other in the game (or should I say, were, that’s the second point). Second, Ashley swooped in last time, having never played, and won both rounds.

This Sunday, I eyeing either Marines vs. Zombies or Ship of the Line. Both are independent releases from FJGaming, which is basically one guy in England. I’ve got MvZ assembled already, and Crista and I will likely assemble “Ship” this weekend. I’ve already learned the rules for MvZ, and trust me, it isn’t hard. They fit on one sheet, in fact. So don’t let the “”http://edge.rpgnow.com/product_info.php?products_id=2864">46 pages" part throw you off.

Hope to see you there. Or do I mean “here”. Well, you know what I mean.

—Mar 30, 2006
